Comment: >“RALEIGH, N.C. (WTVD) -- There is a new chapter in the still-undecided race for a seat on the North Carolina Supreme Court.”  It's genuinely reassuring, seeing this unfold, it's great that this is the only race in the country still unresolved, showing just how critical it is to protect the integrity of elections, and it's great news to see things heading in the right direction... a real key to our legal system, I think.

Comment: I’m glad about the outcome, but it should have never come to this. I wish Jefferson Griffin—and Republicans in office more broadly—were capable of feeling shame for resorting to these tactics. I understand that, for them, it’s all about holding onto power at any cost, but conceding after a loss should be the norm. This was not only cringe-worthy but a waste of time and money.
